intro: Melica aurantiaca var. tandilensis, commonly known as the Tandil red brome, is a grass species native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit and produces inflorescences that are often reddish in color. The plant typically thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands and open areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a hairy texture, and it flowers during the late spring and summer months. This variety is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique coloration and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
